meanings.definition: A type of Italian wine bottle typically covered in a straw basket.
meanings.sent1: The fiaschi on the table added an authentic touch to the Italian dinner party.
meanings.sent2: The waiter carefully poured the wine from the fiaschi into our glasses.
meanings.sent3: During the picnic, the curious squirrel mistook the fiaschi for a cozy nest.
meanings.sent4: Her collection of fiaschi bottles shone like colorful jewels on the shelf.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight filtered through the fiaschi, creating a beautiful pattern on the wall.

meanings.definition: A situation or event that is a complete failure or disaster.
meanings.sent1: The team's performance in the match was a fiaschi they hoped to forget.
meanings.sent2: The project turned into a fiaschi when the main component failed to work.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at baking a cake turned into a fiaschi when he mistook salt for sugar.
meanings.sent4: The party planning was a fiaschi, with the decorations falling apart at the last minute.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick ended in a fiaschi when the rabbit refused to appear from the hat.
